body:
**What happened**:

Housekeeping sync loop finds an orphaned pod and tries to clean it up. The kubepod slice, as seen below, is not removed by `cleanupOrphanedPodCgroups -> go pcm.Destroy(val)` with no indication as to why. This leads to the docker scope timing out and entering a failed state. The returned error(s) from runc are swallowed making debugging difficult.

```
Oct 16 21:18:26 server atomic-openshift-node: I1016 21:18:26.531606    1694 kubelet.go:1907] SyncLoop (housekeeping)
Oct 16 21:18:26 server atomic-openshift-node: I1016 21:18:26.670054    1694 kubelet_pods.go:1082] Killing unwanted pod "test-cron-three-1571285880-bb"
Oct 16 21:18:26 server atomic-openshift-node: I1016 21:18:26.792307    1694 kubelet_pods.go:1682] Orphaned pod "20f666f1-f095-11e9-916f-0050568379a2" found, removing pod cgroups
Oct 16 21:18:26 server systemd: Stopping libcontainer container 4396d3ff70201d494fa265e1966435288d6806acb99f0d601bf56f8804f79a24.
Oct 16 21:19:57 server systemd: docker-4396d3ff70201d494fa265e1966435288d6806acb99f0d601bf56f8804f79a24.scope stopping timed out. Killing.
Oct 16 21:19:57 server systemd: Stopped libcontainer container 4396d3ff70201d494fa265e1966435288d6806acb99f0d601bf56f8804f79a24.
Oct 16 21:19:57 server systemd: Unit docker-4396d3ff70201d494fa265e1966435288d6806acb99f0d601bf56f8804f79a24.scope entered failed state.
```


**What you expected to happen**:
As per other areas of the sync loop, useful errors are logged at debug level due to the async calls.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
N/A

**Anything else we need to know?**:
N/A

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): master
